snippet: President Obama, frustrated in his dealings with President Karzai, is considering speeding up troop withdrawals from Afghanistan and even leaving no American troops after 2014.
abstract: Pres Obama, frustrated in his dealings with Afghan Pres Hamid Karzai, is considering accelerating withdrawal of United States forces from Afghanistan and leaving no American troops there after 2014; Obama's relationship with Karzai has been slowly unraveling, and reached a new low after Karzai scuttled a US effort to begin peace talks with Taliban.

byline.original: By MARK MAZZETTI and MATTHEW ROSENBERG
byline.contributor: Mark Mazzetti reported from Washington, and Matthew Rosenberg from Kabul, Afghanistan. Thom Shanker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: President Obama, frustrated in his dealings with President Karzai, is considering speeding up troop withdrawals from Afghanistan and even leaving no American troops after 2014.

headline.main: U.S. Considers Faster Pullout in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Considers Faster Pullout In Afghanistan

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
